programme.title: The Young and the Restless
programme.desc: An iconic, enduring soap opera, this is the steamer set in Genoa City, where the Newman and Abbott dynasties stir it up in the bedroom and the boardroom. Best known for long-term love triangles, issue-oriented plots, a multi-ethnic cast and slick production values, 'Y&R' has been showered with Emmys, launched countless careers and spawned the equally lavish 'The Bold and the Beautiful.' Former cast members include Tom Selleck and David Hasselhoff. (New).

programme.title: The Bold and the Beautiful
programme.desc: The high-glam soap about L.A.'s fashionable and fertile Forrester clan was designed as a sister soap to the popular 'The Young and the Restless,' and quickly won ratings and global fans with cast crossovers, exotic remotes, glossy runway shows and fast-paced storylines about beautiful people behaving badly. In 2004, the show introduced a new family, the Marones, and recruited several nighttime alums to beef up the cast. And to create a little chaos. (New).

programme.title: The Talk
programme.desc: A weekday gabfest offering a female perspective on the day's headlines and other trending topics, including family, pop culture and health. Celebrity guests are interviewed and music artists perform.

programme.title: Daily Blast Live
programme.desc: A daytime news and entertainment program focusing on trending stories and the latest happenings. Viewers are encouraged to participate in discussions through social media wherein they can send questions, comments, and sundry messages in real-time. The 24-hour live broadcast is hosted by Erica Cobb, Sam Scharer, Ebony Steele, Al Jackson, Tory Schulman, and Jeff Schroeder.

programme.title: S.W.A.T.
programme.desc: 20-Squad scrambles to track down a cold-blooded sniper terrorizing Los Angeles, while Hondo discovers a link to his own South L.A. neighborhood that brings a personal twist to the hunt for the deadly shooter. programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.sub-title: The Heart of a Saturday Night
programme.desc: Danny and Gormley race to find Gus Vanderlip, a committed detective who is dangerously determined to uncover how a rapist he arrested is back on the streets; on the eve of their anniversary, Jamie and Eddie are sent on an undercover assignment to expose a corrupt sober living house; and Henry asks Frank for a favor regarding the NYPD's 9/11 Victims Compensation Fund. (Repeat).(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.
